moves: 1. d3 c5 2. c3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. cxd4 d5
comment:
[A Slav Exchange variation with
colours reversed. According to BCO2, this takes the fun out of playing the
Slav. Does it....?!]

moves: 1. d3 c5 2. c3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. cxd4 d5 5. e4
comment:
[Thanks to Black having played Nc6 before Nf6,
it is possible to play this gambit].

moves: 1. d3 c5 2. c3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. cxd4 d5 5. e4 dxe4 6. d5 Ne5
comment:
[Although at the
time of the game I thought 6... Qa5+ would lose to 7.b4! I am not so sure now,
and think this may win for Black].

moves: 1. d3 c5 2. c3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. cxd4 d5 5. e4 dxe4 6. d5 Ne5 7. Qa4+ Nd7 8. Nc3 Nf6 9. Bf4 g6 10. Nb5 Nxd5
comment:
[I looked here at 11.Qxe4. Now 11... Nxf4 and 11... N5f6 both lose to
12.Nd6#. If 11... e6 then 12.0-0-0 seems fine for White. But 11... N7f6 solves
all Black's problems! So...]

moves: 1. d3 c5 2. c3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. cxd4 d5 5. e4 dxe4 6. d5 Ne5 7. Qa4+ Nd7 8. Nc3 Nf6 9. Bf4 g6 10. Nb5 Nxd5 11. Be5
comment: [The bishop cannot be taken because of Nc7#]
